eu_initiatives:
Evaluation of the EU Drug Programme (DG Justice) 
The RG is involved in the evaluation of the EU Drug Programme, which is currently carried out by DG Justice.  
 
 
Staff Working Document (DG Sante) 
The RG and Correlation - European Harm Reduction Network (CN) contributes to the identification of best practices in the Staff Working Document and in both the Health Policy Platform Library and the Public Health Portal of DG SANTE. 
 
 
EU Drug Action Plan  
De RG/CN is member of the Civil Society Forum on Drugs. One of the activities within the CSFD focus on evaluating the implementation of the EU Drug Action Plan. In 2018 the RG/CN will produce a policy briefing paper to promote the implementation of the EU Drug Action Plan on a national level.  
 
Europe 2020 strategy  
The RG/CN is dedicated to the topics of poverty and social exclusion and aims to increase employment among marginalsed groups. This applies in particular  
to the flagship initiatives of the Europe 2020 strategy, including the Platform against Poverty and Social Exclusion and the Agenda for New Skills and Jobs.

relevant_communication:
The RG coordinates and participates in different kind of European projects and initiatives:  
 
Correlation - European Harm Reduction Network (CN) 
The RG established CN in 2004. The network aims to  
improve the access to and the quality of harm reduction services for People Who Use Drugs, including other related vulnerable and marginalised people and to enhance policies and practices that increase social inclusion. 
CN is granted with a Framework Partnership Agreement in the Health Programme, which will be implemented from 2018-2021. The activities of CN are currently focusing on the development and implementation of a monitoring system for HR services, capacity building and advocacy.  
www.correlation-net.org 
 
Civil Society Involvement Project  
CN coordinates the European Civil Society Project, which is funded by DG Home. The project aims to enhave civil society involvement on national level. www.csdip.eu 
 
Hepatitis C Initiative  
The RG coordinates the European Hepatitis C and Drug Use initiative, which brings together more than 30 organisations – networks, grass root organisations, NGO's, health institutes and universities. The aim of the HepC Initiative is, to contribute to the improvement of knowledge and capacities and to create synergy in order to rise awareness on the issue. A Manifesto with recommendations was presented at the European Parliament and sent to all governments in WHO Europe. 
www.hepatitis-c-initiative.eu 
 
Eurosider Project  
EU Project (DG Home) which develop, validate and implement Safe Use Trainings for drug users.  
 
BETRAD 
Erasmus+ Project focusing on the specific needs of eldery drug users.  
 
Street Support Project  
Erasmus+ project, which promotes inclusive strategies for homeless drug and alcohol users.  
www.streetsupport.eu  
 
48 Hours out  
EU Project (DG Home) targeting harm reduction strategies for released prisoners to reduce overdose.  
 
ATTUNE  
Research project under ERANID Programme, which investigates pathways of Amphetamine Type Stimulant Users.  
 
In addition RG/CN have organised different conferences and policy events, such as the Hepatitis Community Summit, two events which took place at the European Parliament and different kind of national and European  training events.  
 
In 2018, RG/CN will organise the 
- European Harm Reduction Conference in Bucharest 
- European Civil Society Involvement Conference in Brussels  
- Hepatitis C Community Summit in Lisbon  
 
RG/CN is publishing manuals, guidelines, report and policy briefing papers on a regular level, which can all be accessed through www.correlation-net.org

goals__remit:
The Regenboog Group is an Amsterdam based NGO, which provides low threshold and harm reduction services to drug users, homeless people and people with mental health problems. The main aim of the organisation is to reduce social isolation and to support the participation of marginalised groups in society.  
More specifically this includes:  
 
- Low threshold and harm reduction services, such as day and night shelter, Drug Consumption Rooms, needle exchange programme. 
 
- Psycho-social support and counselling: the RG cooperates with a broad network of organisations in Amsterdam to provide support where needed.  
 
- Work integration: the RG runs different work programmes, which support the  (re)integration of marginalised groups in the labour market. 
 
- Informal care and buddy support: a dedicated group of volunteers and professionals supports marginalised groups in managing their daily life(includes also debt assistance). Buddy's play an important role in reducing social isolation and loneliness.   
 
- International cooperation: The RG has an international department, which coordinates a variety of European projects and initiatives. This department coordinates as well Correlation- - European Harm Reduction Network, which has members in more than 220 countries.
